alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Kaibab Plateau; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 12:02PM MST until January 22 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST MONDAY ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Areas of snow above 6500 feet will spread west to east through the afternoon, slowly tapering off from west to east by tonight. Most locations will not see a steady, accumulating snowfall, more likely bursts of snow, that then melts between showers. * WHERE...Areas above 6500 feet near Alpine, Buffalo Pass, Jacob Lake, Pinetop-Lakeside, Whiteriver and Window Rock. * WHEN...From 5 AM early this morning to 8 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Periodic showers will cover up high country roads from time to time in the next 24 hours, use caution and watch for alerts when traveling. Additional snow forecast from 11 AM Today to 8 AM Monday: Alpine 0 to 1 inches Buffalo Pass 1 to 3 inches Jacob Lake 1 to 2 inches Pinetop-Lkside 0 to 1 inches Window Rock 0 to 1 inches
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Black Mesa Area; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Kaibab Plateau; White Mountains
